docs.text: the verdict : spine-chilling drama from horror maestro stephen king , featuring an outstanding , oscar-winning performance from kathy bates .

docs.text: geez , french and saunders had a field day when they set to work on parodying this !

docs.text: sorry , non-british readers may not be familiar with french and saunders - my apologies .

docs.text: the pair are british comediennes ( jennifer saunders later went on to become edina monsoon in " absolutely fabulous " ) , who did a series of film spoofs a few years back , including alien , the exorcist and misery .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: needless to say , amidst her chucklesome impersonation of kathy bates ( the resemblance was quite uncanny ! ) , dawn french got pretty nasty with her sledgehammer when in reach of jennifer saunder's legs !

docs.text: but despite the lingering memory of their sketch , and although i've now seen the film a couple of times now , that " hobbling " scene was no less disturbing !

docs.text: that may be the most memorable scene , but it's certainly not the only worth watching .

docs.text: stephen king , whose film and tv adaptations tend to vary in quality , strikes gold with this simple yet strikingly compelling tale .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's a nicely crafted psychological horror , which effortlessly succeeds in drawing you into the plight of writer phil sheldon ( james caan ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: rescued from a car accident by annie wilkes ( bates ) , who introduces herself as the writer's " number one fan " , he soon becomes her prisoner .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: both the script and kathy bates' beautifully masterful performance ( for which she won an oscar ) work arm-in-arm as we quickly begin to realise that beyond her bubbly exterior the woman is basically as nutty as a fruit-cake ( or is that fruity as a nut-cake ? ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: bates relishes her demanding role , and her performance is nothing short of a masterpiece .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: at times she seems like an innocent victim of her own obsessive behaviour , at times she's a rather tragic character , and more often than not she's just damned scary !
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this is basically a very simple tale , but it achieves a large degree of eloquence in its simplicity .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's an involving , engrossing experience - and considering it's basically a two-hander , mainly set in one locale , it's a remarkable piece of cinema .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there are no jazzy special effects or cheesy action sequences - this one relies solely upon rob reiner's stylish directing and the wonderful performances of bates and caan .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: oh , i haven't really mentioned caan yet - he does a good job as the writer who's a prisoner of his own success ( annie is obsessed with him and his books ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but , as you no doubt gathered from the above - bates is well and truly the star of the show .
